title.narrative: Ghana Local Government Capacity Support Project

description.narrative: i. To strengthen the intergovernmental fiscal framework;ii. To strengthen local public financial management and accountability for improved infrastructure and services in urban assemblies; andiii. To improve citizens' engagement with urban assemblies and their perceptions of urban management.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article IV | Description :The Recipient has appointed a procurement specialist, each for MLGRD, MoFEP and LGSS,respectively, in accordance with Section III.C of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Due Date :15-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Article IV | Description :The Recipient has prepared and adopted, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation, the Operational Manual. | Due Date :15-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Article IV | Description :The Recipient has prepared and adopted, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation, the Project Implementation Manual | Due Date :15-Sep-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II(C) | Description :(ii) The Recipient shall, not later than four months after theEffective Date, finalize in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, the terms of reference to enable the Ghana AuditSer | Due Date :15-Mar-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than two months after the Effective Date,establish the Social Accountability Unit in MLGRD with staffing and resources satisfactory to the Association | Due Date:22-Jun-2011

title.narrative: Disaggregated list of investments by type and/or sector
Number of Social Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability (SPEFA) group meetings held
Participating urban assemblies achieving at least a 5% annual increase in collection efficiency of internally generated funds
Participating urban assemblies achieving acceptable annual external audit opinions
Operational guidelines and /or regulations approved in 5 key reform areas
Transfers received by MMAs by 1 July (DACF + DDF + UDG) against annual total receipts
Timely publication of indicative allocation of UDG to MMAs
Increase in survey scores on citizens# engagement with urban assemblies and their perceptions of urban management
Average UDG performance score of participating MMAs (score)
Variance between MMA allocations and actual receipts of DACF + DDF + UDG
